programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Geoorge explores Java at the heart of the Ring of Fire.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Possibly the home of the deadly Marberg Ebola virus, Kitum Cave is high on Mt.Elgon straddling the Kenya-Uganda border. The deep, waterfall-shrouded cave has been carved out over millennia by elephants in search of salt. When host george kourounis gets bitten by one of the batsandmldr;well, you’ll have to see the show to find out what happens.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: It is time for “Angry Planet” to do a serious desert episode. What better place to do it than this fabled city in the middle of the mighty Sahara Desert.This almost mythical place really does exist. And it really is still possible to travel there by camel caravan, riding the infamous “Ships of the Desert”. Extreme heat, dehydration, possible sand storms, frigid night temperatures and desert predators are our potential companions for the trip.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: No-one creates eco-disasters on quite the scale of the former Soviet Union. In Uzbekistan, the Aral Sea, once one of the largest freshwater lakes in the world, has seen its waters diverted, so that it has shrunk to 1/6 its previous size. In Crimea, a mountain has been carved into a james bondian submarine base. In northern Ukraine, the Chernobyl nuclear site has been reduced to a radioactive wasteland.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: The Land of Ice and Fire – Iceland – is a fascinating and ruggedly demanding country - a perfect subject for exploration by “Angry Planet”. The northern island nation has many of the wild features that we love – volcanoes, glaciers, avalanches, mudslides, big waves, and extreme marine weather. All that – plus weird red and green lights dancing around in the winter sky!

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Monsoon seasons drops as much as 40 feet of water on parts of the parched sub-continent.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Costa Rica is a tiny country jammed with diversity and adventure. George explores the volcanoes of Costa Rica with an international team of scientists, rafts down whitewater rivers in full flood, canyoneers down raging waterfalls, and handles some of deadliest snakes this tropical country has to offer.

programme.title: Viral Wild
programme.desc: What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of the Winter.

programme.title: Viral Wild
programme.desc: Far from the reaches of human society, the animal kingdom thrives.

programme.desc: Adventurer George Kourounis’ patience is tested as he encounters deadly wildlife and challenging elements while preparing to descend into Marum Volcano in the South Pacific.

programme.desc: In these viral videos we witness how, in the blink of an eye, your day can become suddenly dangerous. Even on a beautiful day, when youre not expecting any severe weather at all, Mother Nature can sometimes be malicious and sneaky

programme.desc: A catastrophic earthquake, a mesmerizing avalanche, a destructive tornado, and an unintentional smashup derby on icy highways; our experts weigh in on these viral videos as people get caught off guard by the sudden and powerful forces of nature.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: It is time for “Angry Planet” to do a serious desert episode. What better place to do it than this fabled city in the middle of the mighty Sahara Desert.This almost mythical place really does exist. And it really is still possible to travel there by camel caravan, riding the infamous “Ships of the Desert”. Extreme heat, dehydration, possible sand storms, frigid night temperatures and desert predators are our potential companions for the trip.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: In the porous limestone of Canada’s West Coast, great forces are at work under the ground, building and eroding the underground into fantastic shapes. In this episode we’ll witness George’s explorations of these massive underground cave systems.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Definitely our wildest episode so far. Here’s the deal: Mt. Elgon is an 14,000 foot volcano in eastern Kenya. We propose a safari/ascent of the dormant volcano. Here’s the first kicker: High on the the flanks of the volcano is Kitum Cave – a cave created by the most unique form of erosion – Elephant Erosion. For millennia elephants have been going into the cave to carve it out with their tusks in order to eat the salty rock. Here’s the second kicker: the cave is thought to be the home of the Ebola Marberg virus – the world’s most deadly virus. So here’s the plan: We are going enter the cave, at night, wearing full Bio-Hazard suits to protect us from the virus.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: The Land of Ice and Fire – Iceland – is a fascinating and ruggedly demanding country - a perfect subject for exploration by “Angry Planet”. The northern island nation has many of the wild features that we love – volcanoes, glaciers, avalanches, mudslides, big waves, and extreme marine weather. All that – plus weird red and green lights dancing around in the winter sky!

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: With summer wildfires overpowering the Yukon forests, host/adventurer George Kourounis follows the fabled route of the Klondike Gold Rush sourdoughs through the bawdy town of Skagway, Alaska, paddling the white water rivers and the White Horse Rapids into the Yukon. He travels on mountain bike, steam train and Cessna to experience the huge fires and meet the northern fire crews battling the blazes.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George experiences the most extreme climates in North America. First he visits the hottest place on the continent – Death Valley, then the coldest – Snag, Yukon.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George surfs with the “Hawaian Fire” firefighters.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Monsoon seasons drops as much as 40 feet of water on parts of the parched sub-continent.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: 300 feet from a pocket of molten magma is a chamber filled with giant blue and pink crystals as 60 feet long!

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: George tracks twisters through the Tornado Alley and descends into the Erte Ale Volcano.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: One of the most exciting episodes of season one is “Wild Water” – our look at Great White Sharks, water-filled caves and high voltage marine action.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: The autumn of 2006 brings hurricanes to the North Atlantic and hot dry winds fan forest fires across Northern Ontario. Host/adventurer George Kourounis has traveled to some awesome hurricanes, including Rita and Katrina, with his pal Mark Robinson. This year they stormchase in Newfoundland, site of the hurricane that pulled Mark out of a life-threatening depression.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: We hope Season Two will give us the opportunity to make the quintessential Angry Planet show – a full episode exploring a major hurricane that makes landfall in Florida or the Carolinas.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Italy is one of the very few nations in the world that regularly gets three major extreme natural phenomena – volcanos, flooding, and avalanches. Eastern flanks of the volcano to slip by up to two metres, and many houses on the flanks of the volcano experienced structural damage. The eruption also completely destroyed the Rifugio Sapienza, on the southern flank of the volcano. The Rifugio was the site of a cable car station which had previously been destroyed in the 1983 eruption; both have now been rebuilt. The most recent eruption was in November 2006.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Geoorge explores Java at the heart of the Ring of Fire.

programme.title: Angry Planet
programme.desc: Stormchasing developed in Australia in the same period – the 1990s – as it developed in the American Midwest. In the first week of December – the height of storm season in Australia, we plan to travel with Jimmy Deguara, the most experienced of Australian stormchasers.

programme.title: Martial Arts and meditation
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Martial Arts and meditation
programme.desc: Today, we will meet in Santa Monica in the hub of the last healthy trends. Val will make us discover Erewhon, the biggest organic and hipster supermarket in Los Angeles. She will then meet Troy, a guru of healthy consciousness, for an outdoor class that mixes martial arts and meditation. Then, on the legendary "Muscle Beach", the beach of all athletes, we will meet David, an action movie double, for a very aerial workout.

programme.title: Hotel Paseo, Palm Springs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Hotel Paseo, Palm Springs
programme.desc: Val takes us to discover Palm Springs, the trendy and designer city in the heart of the California desert. In the heart of a private collection, we will discover all the flora of this region: an outdoor plant museum, one of the largest collections of cacti, and even tequila flowers. Then well head to the Paseo Hotel, one of the zen and design hotels of Palm Springs, where well meet the chef of the restaurant who will concoct his signature dishes. We will end our day with a relaxing massage with crystals.

programme.title: Carving a Halloween pumpkin
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Carving a Halloween pumpkin
programme.desc: We meet again in the market garden of Romainville, for a special Halloween episode. In one of our first episodes, we learned how to sow a pumpkin seed. The pumpkins, which I had installed in my vegetable garden, have grown well now that we are in autumn. And thats good because today were going to show you how to dig a pumpkin to make a beautiful Halloween lantern.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Vegetarian Delights - Season 1 - Potato cutlets with vegetable puree
programme.desc: In this recipe, well prepare delicious potato cutlets accompanied by a creamy vegetable puree. The cutlets are crispy on the outside with Japanese breadcrumbs and tender on the inside, while the celeriac puree adds a touch of sweetness and lightness. This dish is perfect for a comforting and tasty vegetarian meal.

programme.title: Creamy cauliflower soup
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Vegetarian Delights - Season 1 - Creamy cauliflower soup
programme.desc: In this recipe, well prepare a creamy, comforting cauliflower and celeriac veloute. This mild, delicate soup is spiced up with condiments like paprika, garlic and oregano, and a touch of olive oil for an even more gourmet texture. An ideal dish for a light starter or a warming dinner.

programme.title: Paul John Elliott
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Paul John Elliott
programme.desc: Without really knowing why, Paul Elliott will change his life from cartoonist to massage therapist. Aspired by success, money, success, he will create several clinics and will eventually lose the human aspects and lose himself. A new turn, a new meeting and Paul will finally resume his dreams of painting. Follow Paul in his tumults and his happiness found.

programme.title: Annabelle Higgins and Valérie Sirois
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Annabelle Higgins and Valérie Sirois
programme.desc: They are beautiful sisters, they are passionate about nature and they have a very strong common point: entrepreneurship. After years of evolution in consumer sectors, discover Annabelle and Valerie who knew how to listen to their passion to create a fitness and surf club (for Annabelle) and a zero waste grocery store (for Valerie).

programme.title: Véronick Desmarais
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Véronick Desmarais
programme.desc: The everyday work is not always easy and it is sometimes difficult to get by. If there is one thing that Veronick has learned from her experience and those around her, it is because she is able to surpass that and to embark on her dreams and plans to become a massage therapist. You will believe in your abilities too.

programme.title: Violaine Courtois
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Violaine Courtois
programme.desc: Everything started from the dream of her parents, she becomes a veterinarian. In her career that she launched backwards, Violaine will meet people who will take her to a different path of life. The chance will be at the rendezvous but it is especially the courage to resume studies and create his company that will build his project. Follow the encounters and travels of Violaine that brought her to fasciatherapy and nonviolent communication.

programme.title: Nature’s Heroes: Gabon - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - Nature’s Heroes: Gabon - Part 2
programme.desc: The incredible diversity of flora and fauna, the fight against climate change, the balance between growth and sustainable development: these are all battles being fought on five continents. Yann Arthus-Bertrand takes us on this expedition. Were off to Gabon to discover the Ivindo National Park and Port-Gentil, then on to Sri Lanka in Kandi. Back to Gabon we go to Libreville, then Lambarene to talk about turtles and the health of the local people. Finally, off to Dhaka-Bangladesh.

programme.title: Nature’s Heroes: Gabon - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - Nature’s Heroes: Gabon - Part 1
programme.desc: How can we reconcile the development needed to sustain the lives of nearly seven billion people with the protection of the Earths natural resources? Yann Arthus-Bertrand and his team have chosen Gabon to continue their survey of the planet. Well be discovering the Kongou Falls, the Langoue clearing with their elephant in Gabon. Then in Colombia, we will go on the island of Malpelo with their shark. Back to Gabon we will discover the Minkebe National Park and the bats in Franceville. We will also go to India in Hyderabad, which has convinced farmers to use no pesticides and no GMOs in their cultivation.

programme.title: Citrus flavors
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - Citrus flavors
programme.desc: Julie takes you through the Pyrenees Orientales, then Corsica, before making a stop on the Côte dAzur, and concludes her journey between Rungis and Paris... all to explore the world of citrus fruits! These fruits add flavor, zest, and seasoning to any recipe, making them indispensable in the kitchen. They bring the warmth and sunshine of the South of France and the exoticism of distant lands. While were all familiar with lemons, clementines, and grapefruits, Julie introduces us to a thousand other varieties.

programme.title: Topanga Canyon, AMBA Yoga
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Topanga Canyon, AMBA Yoga
programme.desc: Val goes to the heart of Topanga Canyon, California, a favorite spot for yoga addicts and nature lovers. Here she will experience AMBA Yoga, a kind of hollistic yoga for women. We will also attend a Sound Bowl session, a Tibetan practice considered the ultimate in meditation. In the heart of Venice Beach, we will discover the "Plant Lab", a new high-tech application that records the vibrations of plants to create music. Finally, Val will present us the largest concept store of rare crystals in South America.

programme.title: Hot Springs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Hot Springs
programme.desc: Still in Palm Springs, we will discover the Parker Hotel, the most trendy and design hotel in town. A French chef will take us to cook in the middle of nature. Then, Val will go to Desert Springs, a town known for its natural hot springs. At one of the many spas in town, Val will test one of the springs and even attend a Sound Bowl session.

programme.title: Growing mushrooms at home
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Growing mushrooms at home
programme.desc: We meet at the Romainville market garden centre to learn how to grow mushrooms at home. Some varieties, such as button mushrooms, oyster mushrooms or shiitake mushrooms, grow quite easily in mushroom houses. But you too can do it. And today we will show you how to make a miniature version of this kit to grow oyster mushrooms at home.

programme.title: Carine (Nice)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Carine (Nice)
programme.desc: After twenty years as a lawyer, Carine decided to give in to her desire to help others heal. Her inner journey led her to discover a passion for naturopathy as she rediscovered her love for nature and learned the healing qualities of the plants around her. Combined with a deep understanding of astrology and nutrition, she is now able to help others live better and find their own path.

programme.title: Virginie (Lyon)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Virginie (Lyon)
programme.desc: Virginie’s beautiful handwritten lettering decorates the walls and windows of many shops in and around Lyon, France, as she lives out her passion of finding beauty in every stroke. A former waitress, Virginie was struggling to find her calling when she suffered a life-altering horse accident that almost left her handicapped. At only 30, she was forced to put her whole life into perspective. She finally found herself through a love for graphic design and lettering, combined with a desire for freedom that came with working independently. To motivate other women, she has also launched “Ladyboss”, a network of inspiring women entrepreneurs.

programme.title: Laetitia (French Alps)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Laetitia (French Alps)
programme.desc: While pregnant with her daughter, Laetitia, a former journalist, experienced a strong desire to change lifestyles and move to the countryside. Remembering the teachings of her grandmother, she began to venture outdoors into the surrounding Alps and study the different plants at her fingertips. Today she holds a wealth of knowledge about the medicinal and aromatherapeutic value of plants that she applies to making natural products. With utmost respect for the environment, Laetitia gathers only what she needs in order to make herbal infusions.

programme.title: Louise (Oleron Island)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Louise (Oleron Island)
programme.desc: At only 20 years old, Louise is full of confidence and already achieved a personal dream of hers to share her passion for nutritious and locally-sourced ingredients on the island of Oleron, France. Repurposing a camping car, she set up a brunch and tea-time spot where the guests can hand-pick their ingredients in the adjacent organic fields. Louise transforms the ingredients into favourite creations of hers and even joins her father for boat trips when she needs to stock up on fresh fish for the menu!

programme.title: Japan: Mass consumption - What the labels forget to mention - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - Japan: Mass consumption - What the labels forget to mention - Part 1
programme.desc: In this instalment, Yann Arthus-Bertrand lifts the veil on the products people buy. Almost everything we buy has a direct impact on our environment. We head to Japan to talk about the impact of new technologies, then to the Republic of Congo in Bukavu for the coltan harvest. How does our total consumption affect the environment? What permanent brands are we imposing on our planet? How can we differentiate between useful and useless purchases?

programme.title: Japan: Mass consumption - What the labels forget to mention - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - Japan: Mass consumption - What the labels forget to mention - Part 2
programme.desc: Above all, these reports are an opportunity for Yann Arthus-Bertrand to take stock of the planet and denounce certain human behaviors that are at the root of dramatic, even irreversible, environmental and climatic degradation. Off to Tokyo, then Kenya, to an animal sanctuary. Then on to Mount Fuji to learn how to live there, and all the plastic that clogs up the seas. Reports will focus on everyday products, chosen for their destructive production practices for both people and the environment.

programme.title: The taste of bread
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - The taste of bread
programme.desc: Today, Julie takes you on a bread trail to uncover the dedicated artisan bakers and millers. Her adventure will lead her through the Libourne region, then onwards to the North of France, the Ardèche, and the Aisne, where bakers have transformed bread into a powerful catalyst for social cohesion. While some individuals may avoid bread, particularly due to gluten-related concerns, others have chosen to reposition it at the forefront of the dining experience by championing its nutritional benefits. This commitment is shared by several chefs whom Julie will meet at the conclusion of her expedition.

programme.title: Escape
programme.desc: Watch beautiful landscapes from all over the world !

programme.title: Ojai Valley Lavender Festival
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Ojai Valley Lavender Festival
programme.desc: Val Kahl is in the heart of Ojai, the lavender town, where she takes a tour in Ojai Valley Lavender Festival and tastes drink, gluten-free cookies and organic cooking products made of lavender. She later found herself in the middle of lavender field while stopping by the Frog Creek Farm. After working out on the hot power yoga around palm trees in Caravan Outpost, she heads out to Gratitude Rock for an organic fresh juice tasting with an avocado ranch view.

programme.title: Japanese pagodas and Coconut Massage
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Japanese pagodas and Coconut Massage
programme.desc: Val goes to Nicholas, a master of enlightenment, at his wellness ranch. Here, Val will try out some new high-tech relaxation sessions. She will then go to one of the zenest hotels in California, where she will participate in a yoga session in a Japanese pagoda, followed by a coconut massage. She will test a Cryo-Cafe, a new concept store that mixes coffee break and cryotherapy session. Finally, she will attend a Theremin session, a very special relaxation ceremony.

programme.title: Thinning seedlings
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Thinning seedlings
programme.desc: We meet in the market garden of Romainville to continue gardening together. In our previous episodes, we sowed chives and radishes. Today, were going to learn how to take good care of them. And as a bonus, well show you a great technique to easily get even more plants in your garden. Lets get started!

programme.title: Escape
programme.desc: Watch beautiful landscapes from all over the world !

programme.title: Risotto with asparagus
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Vegetarian Delights - Season 1 - Risotto with asparagus
programme.desc: In this recipe, we prepare a creamy asparagus risotto, a delicate and refined dish. Arborio rice is slowly simmered in a flavorful broth, then combined with crisp asparagus and melted Parmesan. A hint of lemon and fresh herbs enhances this delicious and comforting meal.

programme.title: Potato cutlets with vegetable puree
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Vegetarian Delights - Season 1 - Potato cutlets with vegetable puree
programme.desc: In this recipe, well prepare delicious potato cutlets accompanied by a creamy vegetable puree. The cutlets are crispy on the outside with Japanese breadcrumbs and tender on the inside, while the celeriac puree adds a touch of sweetness and lightness. This dish is perfect for a comforting and tasty vegetarian meal.

programme.title: Juliette (Morbihan)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Juliette (Morbihan)
programme.desc: Juliette has long been aware of the delicate beauty of nature. For years she spent her life on the sea, organising regattas for the traditional sailboats that are famous in the French region of Morbihan. Her appreciation for the elements made for a smooth transition as she decided to leave the water behind and return to the earth. Learning to shape a ball of clay into a graceful and elegant object, she discovered a passion for ceramics. Today, she lives from her creations and makes pieces that reflect their surroundings, the stunning Gulf of Morbihan.

programme.title: Anna (Brittany)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Anna (Brittany)
programme.desc: Anna’s unusual background provided inspiration for her life change. Her career began as a wolf trainer for cinema and it was during these years that she developed her deep love for animals. After being tired of seeing them used as props and constantly in cages, she decided to leave the world of show business behind and start an eco-friendly sheep and goat pasture. To further share her passion for these gentle animals, Anna has opened a conservatory farm where visitors can experience first-hand the joys of being close to nature. She also makes amazing goat cheese!

programme.title: Cristina (Spain)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Cristina (Spain)
programme.desc: At 31 years old, the last thing Cristina expected when she went to see the doctor about a blocked ear was to leave the consultation with a diagnosis for Breast Cancer. This young and passionate sociologist decided to apply the same philosophy to her treatment as she did when surfing: when a wave crashes down on you, get up and try again. Through her healing journey she deepened her love for the ocean and also discovered the therapeutic capabilities of yoga for cancer patients. Today she shares her practice through surf and yoga retreats and is specialised in oncological yoga, helping others heal.

programme.title: Idoia (Spain)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Idoia (Spain)
programme.desc: Idoia thrives on weaving together the sources of inspiration that surround her. Heavily influenced by the natural beauty of her home region of Galicia, Spain, she creates unique woven pieces from diverse and beautiful materials. Idoia’s pieces represent her vision of a modern woman, drawing from the traditions and experiences of those who perfected the craft before her and also pushing to innovate and adapt her creations for the modern world. Her recent collaboration with luxury fashion house Loewe is a dream come true for this modern artisan.

programme.title: Nature’s Heroes: Bangladesh - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 4 - Nature’s Heroes: Bangladesh - Part 1
programme.desc: With Bangladesh as a running thread, Yann Arthus-Bertrand meets several people who have changed their lives to dedicate themselves to a major project. In Bangladesh, Yves and Runa Marre have created the Friendship Foundation. Among other things, they’ve created a floating hospital installed on an old barge bought in France. Julie Andersen, an ex-advertising executive from New York has come to South Africa to defend sharks with her Shark Angels Foundation. In North India, Kartik Satyanarayan is helping to stop the dreadful exploitation of the lippus bears (dancing bears). He’s created Wildlife SOS, a preserve to rehabilitate the bears that have been rescued and to give work to the men of...

programme.title: USA: The end of oil - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - USA: The end of oil - Part 1
programme.desc: "The end of oil" is the amazing story of a raw material which has revolutionized mans life in just a century. But today, oil reserves are depleting. In his crazy race for always more production, Man didnt manage to preserve this precious energy that took million years for the Earth to give out. To tell the adventure of oil, Yann Arthus-Bertrand and his team went to the United States, the country which depends the most on black gold. At the start of the 21st century, it is now urgent to realize that oil resources are limited. Its today that we have to act and get organized, in order to prepare the new era to come. While all our economies are based on the petrol barrels price, well...

programme.title: A la carte grills
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - A la carte grills
programme.desc: If youre a nature enthusiast and a fan of outdoor cooking, the upcoming season is perfect for barbecue enthusiasts! Our journey will take us to Aube, nestled in the heart of the Brevonnes forest, and then to the Massif des Bauges, where grilling and snow create a unique combination. Afterward, well explore the Libournais region, where well uncover cooking techniques that make use of vine shoots, which are plentiful in the area. Just a short distance from the vineyards, well arrive at another corner of Gironde, the Blaye region, where the cooking method remains consistent but features a distinctly local ingredient: eel.

programme.title: Escape
programme.desc: Watch beautiful landscapes from all over the world !

programme.title: Cryotherapy and Vinyasa Yoga
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Cryotherapy and Vinyasa Yoga
programme.desc: Its in an episode full of surprise that we meet with Val Khal in the heart of Los Angeles for a visit to the new trendy wellbeing boutique Springs. This new concept store offers the opportunity to make Vinyasa yoga wearing a trendy outfit, treat yourself to a revitalizing juice detox before heading to a Cryotherapy session without leaving the venue! For a relaxing time after an intensive Vinyasa yoga session, Val takes you to a session of Fire cupping where the heath is ideal for getting rid of muscular pains from day-to-day stress.

programme.title: Acro Yoga on a Skyscraper
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Acro Yoga on a Skyscraper
programme.desc: Val takes us to Los Angeles, on the roof of one of the most prestigious hotels in Beverly Hills for a session of acro yoga, aerial acrobatic yoga. Then, in the heart of Downtown, Val will experience a glass slide down one of the tallest towers in California. Shell also try SandBox Fitness, the trendy indoor surfing class, before trying Lazerfit, a new way to work out that combines warm-up, stretching and laser tag.

programme.title: Cutting a tomato plant
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Cutting a tomato plant
programme.desc: We meet a in the market garden of Romainville to continue gardening together. Come on, lets see how they have grown.

programme.title: Daniel Hautot
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Daniel Hautot
programme.desc: He had a real professional rise, quickly moving from commercial to sales manager. But the awareness quickly catches up with him too: what is the purpose of all this? Is it a real pursuit of happiness? Daniel keeps his acquired skills and puts them to the benefit of his passion for yoga. Follow Daniel until the opening of his yoga and community space.

programme.title: Guillaume Nivelle
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Guillaume Nivelle
programme.desc: To make a profession representative of his personality is the discovery made by Guillaume at twenty-six. After several years as a bartender and crossing a dark period, Guillaume discovers nature and falls in love with it. Accompany Guillaume in his passion, in the middle of a refitted nature.

programme.title: Laura Belfadla
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Laura Belfadla
programme.desc: Laura will not tell you the whole truth because she does not want a system where you are told what to do. After several years as head of business development in law firm, Laura changes her life and creates the plant academy. Let yourself go for a healthier life.

programme.title: Laurence Sala
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 2 - Laurence Sala
programme.desc: It took a burnout and several miscarriages to Laurence to take a new path. Its finally a bad thing for a good. Throughout her ordeals, Laurence will know how to listen to her needs, her desires and her passions. With a surprise, follow Laurence in her life as a mother and naturopath.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Origami - Season 1 - The Iris flower

We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

programme.title: Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 1 - Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 2
programme.desc: Through the most magnificent images and amazing human stories, Man is at the heart of the biodiversity that he must respect and preserve. We go to China in the province of Yunan, where a plant with exceptional virtues against malaria has been discovered. Then we travel to Africa, where mans intervention in the ecosystem of Lake Victoria has triggered a considerable imbalance. We will also explore to Greenland to meet the polar bears, the first victims of the melting ice.

programme.title: Sweets on the menu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - Sweets on the menu
programme.desc: Today, Julie takes us down a different kind of yellow-brick road, one that tastes of childhood and gourmet delights: the road of sweets. France may be famous for its gastronomy, but its not to be outdone when it comes to pastries and confectionery - quite the opposite. “Betises” from Cambrai, "Berlingots” from Carpentras, "Calissons” from Aix-en-provence, every region in France has its own sweet or confectionery.

programme.title: Escape
programme.desc: Watch beautiful landscapes from all over the world !

programme.title: Acrobatic Yoga
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Acrobatic Yoga
programme.desc: In this episode, Val gets to know Jamie and her thirty gons whom mystical sounds invite to introspection and relaxation in a relaxing setting. She then attends a perilous acrobatic yoga class with Vibe Yoga where her sense of balance has been challenged a few times. Believe or leave! This is Bol Meditation’s motto where Val discovers the benefits of Intense meditation on our body and mind. All together, this place is a piece of heaven in the middle of ettic L.A.

programme.title: Chromo Yoga and Detox Juices with Mia Frye
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Chromo Yoga and Detox Juices with Mia Frye
programme.desc: Val will make us discover Chromo Yoga, which combines light and color therapy with yoga. Then well meet Mia Frye who will present us all the detox cures of the moment at Atelier Nubio. Finally, Val will test gluten-free gourmet waffles, both sweet and savory, the new trendy dessert for Parisian women.

programme.title: Melliferous plants
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Melliferous plants
programme.desc: Lets get together to continue discovering new plants together. Look at all these flowers, they are honey plants. But what are honey plants? Doesnt that make you think of another word? The word honey? Yes, because honey plants are plants that attract insects, and in particular bees, which feed on these flowers to make honey.

programme.title: Destination Sardinia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Blue Zones of Longevity - Season 1 - Destination Sardinia
programme.desc: The first stop on this journey to the land of happy, long life is the Ogliastra region of Sardinia. Here, almost one in five inhabitants is over 90 - 20 times more than in France! Yet this is a far cry from the Mediterranean diet recommended by nutritionists: meat and cholesterol galore. Even more astonishing, consanguinity is paradoxically conducive to the extreme longevity of the inhabitants... our wellness food specialist and a general practitioner will investigate these phenomena and meet nonagenarians and centenarians with exceptional stories.

programme.title: Volcanoes: The violent Earth - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 4 - Volcanoes: The violent Earth - Part 2
programme.desc: To better understand the role of these explosive mountains located all over the world, on land or under the sea, Yann Arthus-Bertrand goes to Italy, the country with the most active volcanoes in Europe. Accompanied by volcano expert Jacques-Marie Bardintzeff, the photographer meets those people who have chosen to live with « their » volcano, in spite of the dangers involved in this kind of proximity.

programme.title: Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 1 - Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 1
programme.desc: Through the most magnificent images and astonishing human stories, Man is at the heart of the biodiversity that he must respect and preserve. We find ourselves in Kenya, where the biodiversity is particularly rich, in the Massaï Mara reserve. Then, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, where the worrying disappearance of hippos from Lake Edward has unexpected consequences for the survival of fishermen. Then, in the sanctuary of life, the Pantanal region in Brazil, where millions of animal and plant species are teeming, some of the worlds great wetlands also in danger. In Tasmania, Yann Arthus-Bertrand fights against the napalm deforestation of one of the oldest and most beautiful forests...

programme.title: The flavors of flowers
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - The flavors of flowers
programme.desc: Eating flowers might appear unconventional, but we often consume them without even realizing it. Consider artichokes, for instance : they are essentially large, unopened flowers. Capers are the preserved buds of flowers soaked in vinegar, and cloves are dried flower buds. We also find courgette flowers, saffron pistils, orange blossom water used to flavor pastries, and the violet sweets that evoke memories of our childhood. In addition to adding aesthetic appeal and providing a dose of vitamins to our plates, flowers elevate the flavors of a dish and can even serve as a vegetable substitute.

programme.title: Hot Yoga Session
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Hot Yoga Session
programme.desc: Always on the look for looking for new detox discoveries, Val leads us to Lifehouse’s tonic and elixirs. Here, she discovers the range of elixir with therapeutic virtues exhilarating and relaxing. Before leaving, we made a hook by Jacks lab to prepare our own elixir. A private hot Yoga session then awaited Val at the popular Urban Exhale Hot Yoga where wearing a swimsuit could be welcomed. This episode ends on a fruity note as we tasted smoothies with unusual names that seduced Val, especially the 72 and Sun.

programme.title: Zero Gravity Bath with Sinclair
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Zero Gravity Bath with Sinclair
programme.desc: Val gives an appointment to the singer Sinclair, for a floating session: a sensory deprivation technique in a bath. Then, we will discover an experience that is all the rage across the Atlantic, the Barre Shape! Its a class that mixes classical dance, yoga and cardio training. All this in a girly and boudoir atmosphere. After the effort comes comfort! We will meet a Superfood expert who will make us test and discover all the "Superfoods" that are very popular in California and that the whole healthy world is talking about.

programme.title: Collecting seeds
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Collecting seeds
programme.desc: We meet in the market garden of Romainville to learn how to save seeds. As you may have noticed, fruits, such as apples and lemons, contain seeds, but so do some of the vegetables you eat, such as peppers and tomatoes. This is because they are, in fact, fruits just like the apple and the lemon. They come from a flower and therefore contain seeds.

programme.title: Destination Okinawa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Blue Zones of Longevity - Season 1 - Destination Okinawa
programme.desc: Genetic, biological, cultural and dietary factors combine to make the Japanese island of Okinawa a zone of extreme longevity. Why is it that cancer is virtually non-existent here? Well see that the famous Japanese trio of "rice, fish and soy" is not the key to longevity, but a diet based on plants, lots of green leafy vegetables and endemic sweet potatoes. Self-restriction and strong social ties are other elements that our naturopathic chef and attending physician will discover on site, together with local inhabitants and scientists.

programme.title: USA: The end of oil - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - USA: The end of oil - Part 2
programme.desc: "The end of oil" is the amazing story of a raw material which has revolutionized mans life in just a century. But today, oil reserves are depleting. In his crazy race for always more production, Man didnt manage to preserve this precious energy that took million years for the Earth to give out. To tell the adventure of oil, Yann Arthus-Bertrand and his team went to the United States, the country which depends the most on black gold. At the start of the 21st century, it is now urgent to realize that oil resources are limited. Its today that we have to act and get organized, in order to prepare the new era to come. While all our economies are based on the petrol barrels price, well...

programme.title: Greece, Euphoria Retreat
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Reset - Season 1 - Greece, Euphoria Retreat
programme.desc: In this episode of Reset, embark on a transformative journey to Euphoria Retreat.A mystical place offering a holistic approach to well-being aimed at restoring balance between body, mind and soul.After a long struggle with illness, its founder embarked on a personal quest to find balance. An in-depth reflection which resulted in the creation of a place where one could share and transmit this method of well-being. Euphoria Retreat is a clever blend of Taoist and Hellenic philosophy based on the symbolism of the five elements: water, wood, fire, earth and metal. Ancestral wisdom and scientific advances offer a transformative immersion in self-discovery. The tools developed by Euphoria...

programme.title: Italy, Palazzo Fiuggi
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Reset - Season 1 - Italy, Palazzo Fiuggi
programme.desc: In this episode of Reset we discover Palazzo Fiuggi, a haven of well-being located in the heart of the natural springs of Fiuggi, famous for their purifying and healing powers.The Palazzo was born from the vision of a science and health enthusiast. This historic place of well-being offers exclusive medical-scientific therapies combining the healing properties of water with advances in Western medicine and alternative medicines. Upon arrival, a team of specialists carries out a targeted diagnosis to create a personalized protocol, rebalancing the mind, body and soul, with a simple promise: offering a longer and better-lived life.A constantly evolving method, between ancestral wisdom and...

programme.title: Poultry on the menu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julies Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - Poultry on the menu
programme.desc: Julie heads for Burgundy to discover ancient breeds of poultry reintroduced to France thanks to the work of breeder Fred Menager. Well then move on to Auvergne to discover how the famous Label Rouge is awarded and the role of certifying bodies ... because its important to know what ends up on our plates. Julie also travels to the Drôme to cook guinea fowl, before heading to the Perigord to prepare a turkey stew. Julie will then head back up towards the center to discover an amazing fly maker who uses rooster feathers!

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Floating Yoga
programme.desc: Just Float, this is the latest yoga trend and mantra for an relaxed mind. As you enter a fully soundproof studio and float in vats filled with epson salts, you will disconnect from the urban buzz. That is Val’s promise as she takes us to experience this funny trend. With a sain mind comes a sain body: it’s time to head to Clover Juice, the most famous juice address in Los Angeles. As we make our way through Clover’s kitchen, we discover this way of life, mix and learn more on these beverage’s benefits.

programme.title: Animal Farm
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Animal Farm

programme.title: Planting vegetables in the fall
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Planting vegetables in the fall
programme.desc: We meet in the market garden of Romainville, to continue installing vegetables in the vegetable garden. Yes, it is possible, even in autumn. Because if its true that most vegetables are planted in spring or summer, some varieties can be planted in early autumn and are fast-growing, which will allow you to harvest them in late autumn or early winter. Lets get started! Were going to plant winter spinach together and well show you a little trick you need to know to harvest it properly.

programme.title: Claire
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 3 - Claire
programme.desc: One woman’s personal mission to reduce her household rubbish turned into a passion that gave birth to Southeast Asia’s first Zero-Waste Bulk Food shop. Claire is a driven and successful mother of three who turned away from her corporate job to channel her business-savvy into reducing our impact on the environment and contributing to the improvement of her local community.

programme.title: Zaira (Argentina)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Zaira (Argentina)
programme.desc: For a long time Zaira let herself be defined solely as a survivor of the traumatic sexual assault that marked her life. In her healing search, she left behind the busy city life and moved to seek solace in the mountains of Mendoza. It is among these magnificent peaks that Zaira found peace within herself and harmony with her surroundings. Now, eager to help others heal, she is the leader of a trekking initiative that doubles as a support group for other women who are victims of sexual aggression.

programme.title: Ile (Argentina)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Ile (Argentina)
programme.desc: Ileana studied business and worked long hours indoors for a multinational logistics company. Her love for dance and desire for movement drove her to quit her corporate life and begin a new chapter as a fitness trainer. Quickly exhausting the traditional methods available at her local gyms, she began to create innovative and groundbreaking exercise methods of her own. Her goal: to empower women by making them feel strong and feminine at the same time.

programme.title: So the great rivers may live - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 2 - So the great rivers may live - Part 1
programme.desc: Water and its beauty, water and its power, water and its fragility... the water we all need is becoming scarce, through our own fault. Some rivers are dry, others are diverted, cut off by dams, others are simply polluted, and this for decades. We will discover how humans transformed the nature in Argentina, then in China and its disproportionate Three Gorges Dam. We will also go in Botswana with the Okavango, this unique river which flows into a desert forming the famous Okavango Delta. Vu du Ciel makes you discover once again another world, magnificent but threatened.

programme.desc: The Qatar Airways GKA Kite World Tour will electrify the coast of Jericoacoara, Brazil, with competitions in its three big air divisions - TwinTip, Hydrofoil and Surfboard. A total of 57 athletes will be competing for the world championship titles at the premiere.

programme.title: WOF 2023 #50: Profile Marko Grilc
programme.desc: Diese Folge widmen wir dem legendaren Snowboarder Marko Grilc. Sei dabei, wenn wir das Leben und die Leistungen dieser Ikone der Snowboardwelt feiern. Macht euch bereit fur eine herzliche Reise durch das bemerkenswerte Vermachtnis von Marko Grilc.

programme.desc: The Downhill Skateboarding World Championships on the Isle of Man bring the worlds fastest riders to one of the most challenging courses. In the “Stand Up Men” category, you can expect pure speed, fiercely contested races, and breathtaking descents.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup and GWA Wingfoil World Cup - Dakhla (MAR)
programme.desc: The GKA Kite-Surf World Cup and the GWA Wingfoil World Cup in Dakhla, Morocco, bring together the best kite surfers and wingfoilers in the world. The riders show off their technical skills and innovation in the wave riding disciplines.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024 - Ibiraquera (BRA)
programme.desc: Ibiraquera in Brazil is the venue for the GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024, which brings together the best kitesurfers in the world. Athletes from all over the world will compete for the title and show impressive skills in wave riding and strapless freestyle.

programme.title: Copa Kitley GKA Big Air Kite World Cup 2024 - Jericoacoara (BRA)
programme.desc: Jericoacoara/Brazil welcomes the Copa Kitley GKA Big Air Kite World Cup 2024, where the worlds best kiteboarders test the limits of big air. This hotspot provides a stage for breathtaking jumps, technical tricks and intense competitions.

programme.title: Copa Kitley GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup 2024 - Cauipe (BRA)
programme.desc: The Cauipe lagoon is the venue for the Copa Kitley GKA Freestyle Kite World Cup 2024, which brings together the best freestyle kiteboarders in the world. The Brazilian paradise offers the perfect playground for explosive tricks.

programme.desc: The final showdown of the Freeride World Tour 2022 is right around the corner and it’ll take place in Verbier, Switzerland between 26th of March and 3rd of April.

programme.title: Cape Epic 2023 - Stage 3
programme.desc: The Absa Cape Epic is the worlds premier mountain bike stage race. The route changes every year and takes ambitious amateur and professional mountain bikers from all over the world over 650 untamed kilometres through pristine landscapes.

programme.desc: The Absa Cape Epic is the worlds premier mountain bike stage race. The route changes every year and takes ambitious amateur and professional mountain bikers from all over the world over 650 untamed kilometres through pristine landscapes.

programme.desc: The Absa Cape Epic is the worlds premier mountain bike stage race. The route changes every year and takes ambitious amateur and professional mountain bikers from all over the world over 650 untamed kilometres through pristine landscapes.

programme.desc: Through the testimonies of six characters and with the help of amateur footage drawn from three decades of rider archives, this exclusive documentary showcases the birth of urban skateboarding in Marseille.

programme.title: Freeride World Tour - 25 Years Xtreme Verbier - Verbier (SUI)
programme.desc: The Verbier Xtreme gave birth to the Freeride World Tour, the Freeride World Qualifiers and the Freeride Junior Tour and sparked an international wave of competitive freeriding.

programme.title: The legend of Muksu river - Tajikistan
programme.desc: This is a journey to the Silk Road in Central Asia into the adventurous world of canoeing. The Muksu in Tajikistan is one of the three most difficult rapids here. Once immersed in the river, there is no turning back.

programme.title: Trans Hong Kong - A Urban MTB Adventure (HKG)
programme.desc: The urban mountain bike adventure series combines rides in some of the worlds largest cities. In this episode we cycle through the Hong Kong region with none other than Hans “no way” Rey, the grandfather of mountain bike freeriding.

programme.title: Mammut Biggest Peak Project 2 - USA
programme.desc: The Swiss mountaineering company Mammut is celebrating its 150th anniversary with the largest summit project in history: 150 summit ascents are being organized worldwide as part of the “150 Peaks Project”.

programme.title: Dani Arnold - Ice Climbing at Lake Baikal
programme.desc: Swiss extreme sportsman Dani Arnold went on a challenging expedition to the deepest lake on earth - Lake Baikal. The Siberian winter provided accordingly difficult and fascinating conditions.

programme.title: Trans Madeira 2024 Autumn: Full Highlights
programme.desc: Trans Madeira combines the best things the island has to offer with five days of racing in the World’s most diverse terrain, exploring all four corners of the island, starting high in the mountains and finishing down at the ocean.

programme.title: E-Bike World Tour 2024
programme.desc: The Verbier E-Bike Festival, held in Verbier, Switzerland, from August 14-18, 2024, is Europes premier e-mountain biking event, attracting thousands of participants and spectators. In its sixth edition, the festival features a diverse range of activities.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #04: Maneuvre Vancouvre - with Hans Rey
programme.desc: In “Maneuver Vancouver”, mountain bike icons Hans Rey, Steve Peat and Wade Simmons embark on an exciting five-day journey through Vancouver. Join these three legends as they explore this iconic city.

programme.title: WOF 2025 #11: Epic Series – Season Preview
programme.desc: Today we take you on an exciting journey. Get ready for an exclusive preview of the Absa Cape Epic and the Epic Series 2025 - the ultimate test of endurance, skill and teamwork.

programme.title: Mbuzi Dume - Strong Goat - Kilimandscharo (TZN)
programme.desc: Tom Belz was faced with the challenge of his life: The 31-year-old goes through life with one leg and two crutches and then climbs the highest mountain in Africa. He also wants to encourage others with his own story.

programme.title: Climbing Special - Worldwide
programme.desc: Kashmir, the Moab Desert, the famous Matterhorn, icefalls in Norway and Patagonia. We look back on breathtaking adventures, incredible alpine records and never-before-imagined new ascents

programme.title: Red Bull Romaniacs 2022 (ROU)
programme.desc: The Red Bull Romaniacs Extreme Enduro Rally was created in 2004 and takes place for the 19th time this year. The race is spread over five days, the first being the inner-city prologue in front of thousands of enthusiastic fans.

programme.title: FIA Karting World Championships (KZ/KZ2)
programme.desc: The first of the two world championship events of the 2022 FIA Karting season offers a very attractive programme with five categories and more than 320 drivers taking part in Le Mans (FRA) from 1st to 4th September.

programme.title: FIA Karting World Championships (OK/OKJ)
programme.desc: After three consecutive Finals in wet conditions between 2019 and 2021, the Mondokart.com FIA Karting World Champion-ship - OK and OK-Junior saw good weather and high temperatures for the season over the weekend.

programme.title: Episode 39
programme.desc: WORLD OF FREESPORTS 2025 - Episode 39

programme.title: Simple Session 2024 - Skate Final
programme.desc: Simple Session was born in 2000, starting as a small-town competition, it has now blossomed into one of the worlds largest and most prestigious BMX and skateboarding contests. Simple Session 24 is set on August 24-25, promising a spectacular festival!

programme.title: WOF 2024 #34: Red Bull Romaniacs 2024
programme.desc: In this year’s 21st edition of the event, competitors from about 60 nations will be competing, among them the world’s best hard enduro riders like Manuel Lettenbichler (GER), Graham Jarvis (UK), Wade Young (RSA), Mario Roman (ESP) and Michael Walkner (AUT).

programme.title: WES - World E-Bike Series, UCI E-Mountainbike World Cup Cross Country, Race 7 and 8 - Monaco
programme.desc: Hello and welcome to WES World E-Bike Series Round 7 and 8. For the first time since 2019, the Monaco - Alpes-Maritimes Round will welcome the Season Finale, this time with a brand new track in the French area of Turini, and the much awaited awards ceremony.

programme.title: WOF 2024 #35: Motosurf World Championship - Båstad (SWE)
programme.desc: Set against the stunning backdrop of the Swedish coastline, the world’s best motosurfers are ready to go head-to-head. Speed, skill, and pure passion - these are the ingredients for thrilling races on the water. Who will claim the title here in Båstad?

programme.title: WOF 2024 #36: FIA Karting European Championship - Kristianstad (SWE)

programme.title: Trans Madeira 2024 Autumn: Full Highlights
